title: Zimbabwe to feature in Pakistan tri-series after Afghanistan pull out
byline: Zimbabwe will feature in next month’s Twenty20 international tri-series in Pakistan after Afghanistan withdrew over political tension with the host country, officials said Saturday.

title: Asia Rugby Sevens 2025 – Men Storm Semis, Women Falter
byline: The Sri Lanka men’s team showcased their dominance on Day 1 of the Asia Rugby Emirates Sevens Series 2025, cruising into the cup semi-finals at the Colombo Race Course Ground.

title: Asia Rugby Emirates Sevens 2025 – Day 1 Action Photos
byline: The deciding grand finale leg of the Asia Rugby Sevens Series kicked off yesterday (18) at the Colombo Racecourse Grounds.

title: Spanish town bans black cat adoptions during Halloween
byline: The Spanish town of Terrassa in north-eastern Catalonia has temporarily banned the adoption of black cats from animal shelters to prevent potentially sinister ’’rituals’’ during Halloween.

title: PM returns after official visit to India
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya returned to Sri Lanka last night of (18) following an official diplomatic visit to India, airport officials at Katunayake International Airport confirmed.

title: Re-scrutiny results of grade 5 scholarship examination released
byline: The Department of Examinations has announced the release of the re-scrutiny results of the Grade 5 Scholarship Examination held on August 10.

title: Yevan battles for Euroformula Glory at Monza; Motopark team-mate Stack takes win
byline: Sri Lankan racer Yevan David showcased impressive skill in the opening Euroformula race at Monza, starting from pole position and engaging in an intense battle at the front.

title: Consumer Affairs Authority collects over Rs. 27.8Mn in fines for overpriced bottled water
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has collected more than Rs. 27.8 million in fines over a six-month period by taking legal action against vendors who sold bottled drinking water at prices above the approved rates.

title: Zimbabwe to feature in T20I tri-series in Pakistan
byline: Zimbabwe Cricket has accepted the Pakistan Cricket Board’s invitation to participate in a T20I tri-series also featuring Sri Lanka, to be staged in Rawalpindi and Lahore from 17 to 29 November.

title: Air China flight safely diverted to Shanghai after battery fire in cabin
byline: An Air China flight turned into a scene of panic on Saturday when a lithium battery packed inside a passenger’s hand luggage suddenly caught fire mid-air. Flight CA139, which was travelling from Hangzhou to Seoul, had to make an emergency diversion to Shanghai-Pudong Airport after thick smoke began billowing from the overhead compartment.

title: Police report mandatory for election nominees, Says Namal
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organizer and Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa has announced that a police report will be mandatory for anyone seeking party nominations in the upcoming elections, to verify whether candidates have any involvement in drug-related or organized crime activities.

title: Stronger ground-level engagement needed for women and children, says Minister
byline: Minister of Women and Child Affairs Hon. Saroja Savithri Paulraj has emphasized the need for stronger ground-level engagement to improve the lives of women and children in Sri Lanka, stating, “We must become even more active on the ground for the betterment of women and children in our country.”

title: Twelve injured in school bus accident in Ragama
byline: A bus carrying a group of schoolchildren from Sapugaskanda met with an accident near the Batuwatte Railway Station in the Ragama Police Division this afternoon (19).

title: Millions join anti-Trump ’No Kings’ protests across US
byline: Huge crowds have taken part in ’’No Kings’’ protests against President Donald Trump’s policies in cities across the US, including New York, Washington DC, Chicago, Miami and Los Angeles.

title: Belarusian national arrested for cultivating cannabis in Akmeemana
byline: A Belarusian national has been arrested by the Galle District Crime Division for cultivating cannabis inside a rented house in the Akmeemana area.

title: Train derails on Kelani Valley Line; services restricted to Kosgama
byline: A train travelling from Colombo Fort to Avissawella derailed between the Kosgama and Avissawella Railway Stations at around 6.45 p.m. today, the Railways Department confirmed.

title: Israeli military launches attacks on Gaza, ceasefire under strain
byline: The Israeli military said it launched air strikes and artillery fire at targets in southern Gaza on Sunday, dimming hopes that a U.S.-mediated ceasefire would lead to lasting peace as Israel traded blame with Palestinian militant group Hamas.

title: Ihala Kotte derailment: Night mail trains cancelled
byline: The Railways Department has announced the cancellation of the night mail trains from Colombo Fort to Badulla and from Badulla to Colombo Fort following a train derailment near Ihala Kotte Railway Station earlier today.

title: Train services restricted to Rambukkana following Ihal Kotte derailment
byline: All train operations on the Main Line have been restricted to Rambukkana Railway Station, the Railways Department said today.

title: Thieves break into Louvre museum, steal ‘priceless jewellery’
byline: French Culture Minister Rachida Dati on Sunday reported a theft at the Louvre in Paris as the world-renowned museum said it was closing for the day.

title: 31 arrested in Nuwara Eliya during long weekend
byline: Police in Nuwara Eliya have arrested 31 individuals, aged 18 to 35, from various parts of the island, on suspicion of possessing illegal drugs during the long weekend, police said.

title: Train derails near Ihala Kotte, disrupting upcountry line
byline: An intercity express train traveling from Kandy to Colombo Fort at 3:00 pm derailed near Ihala Kotte Railway Station today, the Railways Department said.

title: Air China flight safely diverted to Shanghai after battery fire in cabin
byline: An Air China flight turned into a scene of panic on Saturday when a lithium battery packed inside a passenger’s hand luggage suddenly caught fire mid-air. Flight CA139, which was travelling from Hangzhou to Seoul, had to make an emergency diversion to Shanghai-Pudong Airport after thick smoke began billowing from the overhead compartment.

title: Millions join anti-Trump ’No Kings’ protests across US
byline: Huge crowds have taken part in ’’No Kings’’ protests against President Donald Trump’s policies in cities across the US, including New York, Washington DC, Chicago, Miami and Los Angeles.
